metadata.title: CVE-2021-38509 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Due to an unusual sequence of attacker-controlled events, a Javascriptalert() dialog with arbitrary (although unstyled) contents could bedisplayed over top an uncontrolled webpage of the attacker's choosing. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 94, Thunderbird < 91.3, and Firefox ESR <91.3.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-38509` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 94.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 94.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 94.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:91.3.1+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.3.1+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.3.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.3.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.3.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.3.1+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '94.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.3.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
mozjs78 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
